wolk.wolkcore package¶

WolkCore subpackage is the heart and soul of WolkConnect-Python library. It consists of data classes, enumerations and interfaces.

wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorCommand module¶

ActuatorCommand Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorCommand.ActuatorCommand(reference, command, value=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deserialized actuator command sent from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Actuator command received.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the actuator
  • command (wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorCommandType) – Command to be executed
  • value (int or float or str or None) – Value to be set to

wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorCommandType module¶

Types of actuator commands received from the platform:

ACTUATOR_COMMAND_TYPE_SET = 0

ACTUATOR_COMMAND_TYPE_STATUS = 1

ACTUATOR_COMMAND_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 2

wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorState module¶

ACTUATOR_STATE_READY = 0

ACTUATOR_STATE_BUSY = 1

ACTUATOR_STATE_ERROR = 2

Information about actuator status.

  • reference (str) – Reference of the actuator
  • state (wolk.wolkcore.ActuatorState) – Actuators current state
  • value (int or float or str) – Actuators current value

callback function passes back an wolk.wolkcore.InboundMessage object.

Parameters:listener (wolk.WolkConnect.WolkConnect) – WolkConnect instance

wolk.wolkcore.FileTransferPacket module¶

FileTransferPacket Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.FileTransferPacket.FileTransferPacket(previous_hash, data, current_hash)[source]¶

Bases: object

Hold all data contained from a firmware chunk request response.

Chunk of a firmware file.

Parameters:
  • previous_hash (bytes) – Hash of the previous chunk
  • data (bytes) – Requested chunk
  • current_hash (bytes) – Hash of the current chunk

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareCommand module¶

FirmwareCommand Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareCommand.FirmwareCommand(command, file_name=None, file_size=None, file_hash=None, auto_install=None, file_url=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Firmware update command received from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Firmware command that was received.

Parameters:
  • command (wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareCommandType) – Command to be executed
  • file_name (str or None) – Name of the file to be received
  • file_size (int or None) – Size of the file to be received
  • file_hash (str or None) – Hash of the file to be received
  • auto_install (bool or None) – Install the file when it is received
  • file_url (str or None) – URL where the file is located

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareCommandType module¶

Types of firmware commands received from the platform:

FIRMWARE_COMMAND_TYPE_FILE_UPLOAD = 0

FIRMWARE_COMMAND_TYPE_URL_DOWNLOAD = 1

FIRMWARE_COMMAND_TYPE_INSTALL = 2

FIRMWARE_COMMAND_TYPE_ABORT = 3

FIRMWARE_COMMAND_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 4

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareErrorType module¶

Types of firmware update error states to report the the platform:

FIRMWARE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED_ERROR = 0

FIRMWARE_ERROR_FILE_UPLOAD_DISABLED = 1

FIRMWARE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FILE_SIZE = 2

FIRMWARE_ERROR_INSTALLATION_FAILED = 3

FIRMWARE_ERROR_MALFORMED_URL = 4

FIRMWARE_ERROR_FILE_SYSTEM_ERROR = 5

FIRMWARE_ERROR_RETRY_COUNT_EXCEEDED = 10

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareHandler module¶

FirmwareHandler Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareHandler.FirmwareHandler[source]¶

Bases: object

Handle firmware update process.

Implement this class to write and read files in persistent memory, persist firmware version and handle the process of installation of firmware file itself. Optionally provide implementation for URL download

persist_version(version)[source]¶

Place the current firmware version into persistent storage.

Later to be used to determine the result of the firmware update process

Parameters:version (str) – The current firmware version
Returns:result
Return type:bool
read_chunk(index)[source]¶

Read a chunk of the temporary firmware file.

Parameters:index (int) – offset from the beginning of the file
Returns:chunk
Return type:bytes
set_url_download_result_callback(callback)[source]¶

Set the callback function for reporting the result of URL file download.

Parameters:callback (function) – function to call
unpersist_version()[source]¶

Remove the firmware version from persistent storage.

Returns:version
Return type:str or None
update_abort()[source]¶

Abort the process of firmware update.

update_finalize()[source]¶

Finish the process of firmware update.

update_start(file_name, file_size)[source]¶

Start receiving the firmware file.

Parameters:
  • file_name (str) – name of the firmware file
  • file_size (int) – size of the firmware file in bytes
Returns:

result
Return type:

bool
update_start_url_download(file_url)[source]¶

Prepare the device for the URL file transfer.

Parameters:file_url (str) – The URL that contains the firmware file
Returns:result
Return type:bool
write_chunk(chunk)[source]¶

Write a chunk of the firmware file to the temporary file.

Parameters:chunk (bytes) – A piece of the firmware file
Returns:result
Return type:bool

Status of firmware update process.

Types of firmware statuses to report the the platform:

FIRMWARE_STATUS_FILE_READY = 1

FIRMWARE_STATUS_INSTALLATION = 2

FIRMWARE_STATUS_COMPLETED = 3

FIRMWARE_STATUS_ABORTED = 4

FIRMWARE_STATUS_ERROR = 5

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareUpdate module¶

FirmwareUpdate Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareUpdate.FirmwareUpdate[source]¶

Bases: object

Firmware Update enabler.

Responsible for handling file and URL download, as well as reporting firmware status. Should be implemented to depend upon an object of FirmwareHandler class

handle_abort()[source]¶

Pass the abort command to an instance of FirmwareHandler.

handle_file_download(firmware_command)[source]¶

Pass the information necessary to start a file download to an instance of FirmwareHandler.

handle_install()[source]¶

Pass the install command to an instance of FirmwareHandler.

handle_packet(packet)[source]¶

Pass the packet to an instance of FirmwareHandler.

handle_url_download(firmware_command)[source]¶

Pass the information necessary to start a URL download to an instance of FirmwareHandler.

handle_url_download_result(result)[source]¶

Handle the result of the url file download reported from an instance of FirmwareHandler.

report_result()[source]¶

Report the results of the firmware update process.

set_on_file_packet_request_callback(on_file_packet_request_callback)[source]¶

Set a callback function to handle file packet requests.

set_on_status_callback(on_status_callback)[source]¶

Set a callback fucntion to handle firmware status reporting.

wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareUpdateStateType module¶

Types of firmware update states:

FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATE_IDLE = 0

FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATE_FILE_TRANSFER = 1

FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATE_URL_DOWNLOAD = 2

FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATE_FILE_OBTAINED = 3

FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATE_INSTALL = 4

wolk.wolkcore.InboundMessage module¶

InboundMessage Module.

class wolk.wolkcore.InboundMessage.InboundMessage(channel, payload)[source]¶

Bases: object

Inbound Messages that get received from the platform.

Inbound MQTT message.

Parameters:
  • channel (str) – Channel where the message was published to
  • payload (str or bytes) – Payload of the message that was published to channel

wolk.wolkcore.KeepAliveService module¶

class wolk.wolkcore.KeepAliveService.KeepAliveService[source]¶

Bases: object

Publish messages to the platform in regular intervals.

Keep device connected in cases where no data was sent over 30 minutes.

handle_pong()[source]¶

Handle response from Platform.

start()[source]¶

Publish a ping message in a repeating interval.

stop()[source]¶

Stop the repeating interval.

wolk.wolkcore.WolkCore module¶

class wolk.wolkcore.WolkCore.WolkCore(outbound_message_factory, outbound_message_queue, connectivity_service, actuation_handler, actuator_status_provider, inbound_message_deserializer, configuration_handler, configuration_provider, keep_alive_service=None, firmware_update=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

WolkCore ties together all the functionality of WolkConnect library.

Core of WolkConnect library.

Parameters:
  • outbound_message_factory (wolk.wolkcore.OutboundMessageFactory.OutboundMessageFactory) – Serialize messages to be sent to WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • outbound_message_queue (wolk.wolkcore.OutboundMessageQueue.OutboundMessageQueue) – Store messages that are ready to be sent
  • connectivity_service (wolk.wolkcore.ConnectivityService.ConnectivityService) – Provide communication with WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • actuation_handler (wolk.ActuationHandler.ActuationHandler) – Execute actuation commands issued from WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • actuator_status_provider (wolk.ActuatorStatusProvider.ActuatorStatusProvider) – Report current actuator status to WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • inbound_message_deserializer (wolk.wolkcore.InboundMessageDeserializer.InboundMessageDeserializer) – Deserialize messages received from WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • configuration_handler (wolk.ConfigurationHandler.ConfigurationHandler) – Execute configuration command received from WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • configuration_provider (wolk.ConfigurationProvider.ConfigurationProvider) – Report current configuration options to WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • keep_alive_service (wolk.wolkcore.KeepAliveService.KeepAliveService or None) – Maintain connection to WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • firmware_update (wolk.wolkcore.FirmwareUpdate.FirmwareUpdate or None) – Update device’s firmware from WolkAbout IoT Platform
add_alarm(reference, active, timestamp=None)[source]¶

Store an alarm state to be published the platform.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the alarm
  • active (bool) – Current state of the alarm
  • timestamp (int or None) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign
add_sensor_reading(reference, value, timestamp=None)[source]¶

Store a sensor reading to be sent to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the sensor
  • value (int or float or str) – Value of the sensor reading
  • timestamp (int) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign
connect()[source]¶

Connect to WolkAbout IoT Platform and start keep alive service.

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnect from WolkAbout IoT Platform and stop keep alive service.

publish()[source]¶

Publish all currently stored messages to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

publish_actuator_status(reference)[source]¶

Publish the current actuator status to the platform.

Parameters:reference (str) – Reference of the actuator
publish_configuration()[source]¶

Publish the current device configuration to the platform.
